rules.natural: Provided that the earthquake alert is confirmed, then if it is not the case that either the power grid is stable or the implication that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing leads to the communication system not being operational, then the evacuation procedure is initiated.
Whenever a weather warning is received, then if the absence of a storm being ongoing does not ensure that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is not operational.
In the event that the seismic sensor is triggered, then provided that a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.
Either the seismic sensor is triggered or the smoke detector is activated.
Should the smoke detector be activated, then assuming a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.
Given that it is not the case that either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing, then the communication system is operational.
In the scenario where it is not true that if the emergency protocol is activated then the response team is deployed, an alternative protocol is available.
Provided that the activation of the emergency protocol does not lead to the deployment of the response team, then an alternative protocol is not available.

If the negation of the condition that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing does not imply that the communication system is not operational, then the emergency protocol is activated.
In the event that the absence of a storm being ongoing does not guarantee that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is operational.
If a weather warning is not received, then flood protection is activated.
Assuming a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is not functional.

facts.natural: It is not the case that the backup generator has power for the facility.
The evacuation procedure is not initiated.
The response team is not deployed.
The power grid is not stable.

steps.natural: If the emergency protocol is activated, then the response team is deployed.
The emergency protocol is not activated.
If it is false that either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing, then the communication system is not operational.
Either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing.
Provided that a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.

Whenever it is not the case that either the power grid is stable or the implication that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing results in the communication system not being operational, then the evacuation procedure is initiated.
Either the power grid is stable or the condition that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing implies that the communication system is not operational.
If it is false that either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing, then the communication system is not operational.
Either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing.
Should the lack of a storm being ongoing fail to ensure that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is not operational.
Provided that a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing.

(A11 → (¬(A9 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → ¬A2)) → A10).natural: Provided that the earthquake alert is confirmed, then if it is not the case that either the power grid is stable or the implication that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing leads to the communication system not being operational, then the evacuation procedure is initiated.

(A13 → (¬(¬G → A6) → ¬A12)).natural: Whenever a weather warning is received, then if the absence of a storm being ongoing does not ensure that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is not operational.

(A3 → A4).natural: If the emergency protocol is activated, then the response team is deployed.

(A7 → (¬G → A6)).natural: In the event that the seismic sensor is triggered, then provided that a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: Either the seismic sensor is triggered or the smoke detector is activated.

(A8 → (¬G → A6)).natural: Should the smoke detector be activated, then assuming a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.

(A9 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → ¬A2)).natural: Either the power grid is stable or the condition that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing implies that the communication system is not operational.

(¬(A1 ∨ G) → A2).natural: Given that it is not the case that either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing, then the communication system is operational.

(¬(A1 ∨ G) → ¬A2).natural: If it is false that either the backup generator has power for the facility or a storm is ongoing, then the communication system is not operational.

(¬(A3 → A4) → A5).natural: In the scenario where it is not true that if the emergency protocol is activated then the response team is deployed, an alternative protocol is available.

(¬(A3 → A4) → ¬A5).natural: Provided that the activation of the emergency protocol does not lead to the deployment of the response team, then an alternative protocol is not available.

(¬(A9 ∨ (¬(A1 ∨ G) → ¬A2)) → A10).natural: Whenever it is not the case that either the power grid is stable or the implication that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing results in the communication system not being operational, then the evacuation procedure is initiated.

(¬(¬(A1 ∨ G) → ¬A2) → A3).natural: If the negation of the condition that either the backup generator does not have power for the facility or a storm is ongoing does not imply that the communication system is not operational, then the emergency protocol is activated.

(¬(¬G → A6) → A12).natural: In the event that the absence of a storm being ongoing does not guarantee that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is operational.

(¬(¬G → A6) → ¬A12).natural: Should the lack of a storm being ongoing fail to ensure that the emergency lighting is functional, then the backup generator is not operational.

(¬A13 → A14).natural: If a weather warning is not received, then flood protection is activated.

(¬G → A6).natural: Provided that a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is functional.

(¬G → ¬A6).natural: Assuming a storm is not ongoing, the emergency lighting is not functional.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the backup generator has power for the facility.

¬A10.natural: The evacuation procedure is not initiated.

¬A3.natural: The emergency protocol is not activated.

¬A4.natural: The response team is not deployed.

¬A9.natural: The power grid is not stable.
